cluster_relations.rel_desc: Sports teams can serve as powerful brands.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: BrandRole: commercial identity for marketing and sponsorship

cluster_relations.rel_desc: Athletes themselves can serve as powerful brands.

qualifiers.OtherQualifier: BrandRole: personal brand for endorsements and sponsorship
Outcome: sponsorship deals bringing in revenue

qualifiers.OperationalConstraint: in commercial sports and media contexts
qualifiers.OtherQualifier: FinancialOutcome: endorsements bring in millions of dollars in revenue

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject functions as a brand entity in a commercial or marketing context (e.g., as a marketable identity or asset).
args.justification: Both relations describe entities (sports teams, athletes) functioning in the role of powerful brands; the semantics are that the subject is used/treated as a brand, not that it merely has one.

args.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject draws or attracts the object (e.g., sponsors, endorsements) as a result of its characteristics or appeal.
args.justification: Both relations describe powerful brands drawing in commercial counterparties (sponsors, endorsements); the core predicate is that the brands attract these objects.
args.remark: Kept a general predicate ('attracts') so it can be reused for other attraction relations beyond sponsorship/endorsement if needed.

args.justification: These relations concern entities taking on the role or identity of a brand in marketing and sponsorship contexts, forming a coherent class of brand-role relations.

These relations describe commercial appeal, where a brand's strength causes the attraction of sponsors and endorsements; they form a class of relations about attracting commercial partners or support.
The key semantics are that the subject is identified and used as a brand (a role/identity), rather than causing an outcome or composing a whole.
The relations express that the existence or strength of the brand causes or leads to the attraction of sponsors and endorsements, fitting a causal/outcome dimension.

executed_decisions.canonical_rel_desc: Indicates that the subject functions as a brand entity in a commercial or marketing context (e.g., as a marketable identity or asset).
executed_decisions.justification: Both relations describe entities (sports teams, athletes) functioning in the role of powerful brands; the semantics are that the subject is used/treated as a brand, not that it merely has one.

executed_decisions.remark: Kept a general predicate ('attracts') so it can be reused for other attraction relations beyond sponsorship/endorsement if needed.
